channel.title: CVE Feed for AMD -- AMD Radeon™ RX 6000 Series Graphics Cards
channel.description: The latest CVEs for AMD -- AMD Radeon™ RX 6000 Series Graphics Cards

item.title: CVE-2023-31304|2024-08-14T14:27:25.519Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: Improper input validation in SMU may allow an attacker with privileges and a compromised physical function (PF) to modify the PCIe® lane count and speed, potentially leading to a loss of availability.

item.title: CVE-2023-20509|2024-08-14T14:31:23.896Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: An insufficient DRAM address validation in PMFW may allow a privileged attacker to perform a DMA read from an invalid DRAM address to SRAM, potentially resulting in loss of data integrity.

item.title: CVE-2023-31307|2024-08-13T16:54:03.514Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: Improper validation of array index in Power Management Firmware (PMFW) may allow a privileged attacker to cause an out-of-bounds memory read within PMFW, potentially leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-31304|2024-08-13T16:53:44.552Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: Improper input validation in SMU may allow an attacker with privileges and a compromised physical function (PF) to modify the PCIe® lane count and speed, potentially leading to a loss of availability.

item.title: CVE-2023-20509|2024-08-13T16:52:00.677Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: An insufficient DRAM address validation in PMFW may allow a privileged attacker to perform a DMA read from an invalid DRAM address to SRAM, potentially resulting in loss of data integrity.

item.title: CVE-2023-31310|2024-08-13T16:54:05.783Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: Improper input validation in Power Management Firmware (PMFW) may allow an attacker with privileges to send a malformed input for the "set temperature input selection" command, potentially resulting in a loss of integrity and/or availability.

item.title: CVE-2023-20510|2024-08-13T16:52:11.777Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: An insufficient DRAM address validation in PMFW may allow a privileged attacker to read from an invalid DRAM address to SRAM, potentially resulting in data corruption or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-31305|2024-08-13T16:53:42.810Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: Generation of weak and predictable Initialization Vector (IV) in PMFW (Power Management Firmware) may allow an attacker with privileges to reuse IV values to reverse-engineer debug data, potentially resulting in information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2023-20512|2024-08-13T16:52:33.888Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: A hardcoded AES key in PMFW may result in a privileged attacker gaining access to the key, potentially resulting in internal debug information leakage.

item.title: CVE-2023-20513|2024-08-13T16:52:35.499Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: An insufficient bounds check in PMFW (Power Management Firmware) may allow an attacker to utilize a malicious VF (virtualization function) to send a malformed message, potentially resulting in a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-31305|2024-08-13T18:27:50.120Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: Generation of weak and predictable Initialization Vector (IV) in PMFW (Power Management Firmware) may allow an attacker with privileges to reuse IV values to reverse-engineer debug data, potentially resulting in information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2023-20510|2024-08-13T18:04:03.094Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: An insufficient DRAM address validation in PMFW may allow a privileged attacker to read from an invalid DRAM address to SRAM, potentially resulting in data corruption or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-31307|2024-08-13T18:03:32.273Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: Improper validation of array index in Power Management Firmware (PMFW) may allow a privileged attacker to cause an out-of-bounds memory read within PMFW, potentially leading to a denial of service.
